item.title: T-1 Digital Phone Lines For PBX Systems
item.description:
Many modern business phone systems utilize T-1 lines to link their buildings to the local telephone company. This is because merging multiple individual lines into one or two T-1 lines is more cost-efficient. This holds true whether your internal phone system is analog or digital, as even most VoIP systems rely on T-1 lines for external calls. Smaller setups like basic one or two-line phones or key systems with 4-6 lines typically use analog lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t-1-digital-phone-lines-for-pbx-systems/

item.title: T1 Phone Lines Offer More For Less
item.description:
When your business expands and your phone bills become a significant expense, it might be time to consider a service that offers higher volume at a lower cost. This is especially relevant if you’ve established a dedicated customer contact center or if your business has grown to require a dozen or more external phone lines. The service that aligns with this need is a T1 telephone line. Unlike a single phone line, a T1 “line” is a digital trunk line...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t1-phone-lines-offer-more-for-less/
